selection_reasoning: Generation 15 confirmed the 1.0000159135539168 plateau. Selection focuses on the analytical Jacobian method (15_3, 15_0) which consistently reaches this peak, while keeping derivative-free (15_4) and symmetry-constrained (14_0) approaches to explore beyond the current gradient-based limits.

trial_selections.reasoning: Highest score (1.0000159135539168). Uses exact analytical Jacobians and a micro-shaking basin-hopping strategy, which is the most effective method for overcoming numerical precision limits.
Uses a hybrid SLSQP + Powell approach. Powell's method is derivative-free and provides a useful alternative for exploring the landscape without gradient-based bias.
A clean, high-precision implementation of the slack-variable SLSQP with analytical Jacobians. Excellent base for further optimization.
Symmetry-constrained (D6d) approach. Maintains structural diversity in case the Oh symmetry (Rhombic Dodecahedron) is not the absolute global maximum.
